alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 21 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Air Quality Alert in effect for Tuesday August 22... The Mid-America Regional Council has issued an Air Quality Alert...in effect for Tuesday August 22. Outdoor Air Quality Index, or AQI, values in excess of 100 are expected with ozone being the primary pollutant. People and businesses are urged to avoid activities which lead to ozone formation. These activities include refueling vehicles or topping off when refueling idling vehicles unnecessarily and using gasoline powered lawn equipment. Positive activities include car pooling, biking to work, delaying or combining errands, and using water-based paints and cleaners. When pollution levels are elevated, the Mid-America Regional Council recommends that individuals consider limiting strenuous outdoor physical activity to reduce the risk of adverse health effects. People who may be especially sensitive to the effects of elevated levels of pollutants include the very young, and those with pre- existing respiratory problems such as asthma or heart disease. Those with symptoms should consider consulting their personal physician. For further information please see the Mid-America Regional Council air quality program website at http://www.airqkc.org.
